event.title: was incorporated as a village in 1834

data.event: It was incorporated as a village in 1834.
A court battle ensued over the ownership of the name Plymouth, which Chrysler lost when it was determined the original Plymouth car preceded Chrysler's by several years.
The tractors were produced until the 1950s when it was sold to Mountain State Engineering in West Virginia and then discontinued.

event.title: hosts the annual Silver King Festival during the first week of August

data.event: The village hosts the annual Silver King Festival during the first week of August when restored Silver Kings tractors from around the world are displayed.
